* Parse the input string into it's command and arguments.

// command is always the first word in the input
* Parse the argument(s) from an input string.

* <li>"/" not at the start of a word, will not be recognized as a special character.

* An Action encapsulates the behaviour of a {@link Command} and it's {@link Argument}(s).
* <li>An action can be executed, with validation checks.
* Constructor for this action, which validates that it's arguments are valid.
* @param command the command associated with this action
* @param suppliedArguments the arguments supplied with the command
* @throws ActionException If the action fails has unrecognizable or missing arguments.
public Action(Command command, Argument... suppliedArguments) throws ActionException {
* Factory method to create an action instance.
* @param command the command as a string
* @param parsedArguments the arguments, parsed from the input
* @throws ActionException If the command or arguments are not one of the expected values.

* Gets the command of this action.

// null represents that the argument of that name does not exist,

* Finds the default argument of this action.

* Executes this action, which may modify the state of stored tasks,
* and may print to the console.
* @param taskList the taskList that is used with the chatbot
* @throws ActionException If the action fails certain validation checks due to invalid input.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList) throws ActionException;

"Now you have " + taskList.size() + " task(s) in the list."

"Now you have " + taskList.size() + " task(s) in the list."
* ByeAction encapsulates the behaviour when ending the chat.
* @param arguments the arguments supplied with the command

* Greets the user when exiting the application.

Printer.printMessages("Bye! Hope to see you again soon!");

// Validate that indexString is in the range

* ActionException represents exceptions specific to {@link action.Action},
* which are thrown when invalid input results in an action being invalid,
* and is unable to recover a valid state.
public abstract class ActionException extends Exception {
* InvalidArgumentValueException represents exceptions due to an invalid argument value in an argument.
* Constructor for this ActionException with an invalid argument value.
public InvalidArgumentValueException(Command command, String invalidArg, String reason) {
return "OOPS!!! The argument value <" + invalidArg + "> of `" + command.getName() + "` is invalid!\n"
* MissingArgumentException represents exceptions due to a missing argument in an action.
* Constructor for this ActionException with a missing argument.
return "OOPS!!! The argument `/" + missingArg.getName() + "` of `" + command.getName() + "` must be present!\n"
* MissingArgumentValueException represents exceptions due to a missing argument value for an argument in an action.
* Constructor for this ActionException with a missing argument value.
return "OOPS!!! The argument value <" + missingArg.getValue() + "> of `" + command.getName() + "` must be present!\n"
* UnexpectedArgumentValueException represents exceptions due to the presence of a value
* in an argument that does not require a value.
* Constructor for this ActionException for unrecognized argument names.
return "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I didn't expect <" + argument.getValue() + "> :-(\n"
* UnrecognizedArgumentException represents exceptions due to an unrecognized argument name in the action.
* Constructor for this ActionException for unrecognized argument names.
* @param argument the name of the argument
return "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what `/" + argument.getName() + "` means :-(\n"
* UnrecognizedCommandException represents exceptions due to an unrecognized command in the input.
* Constructor for this ActionException for unrecognized commands.
* @param commandName the name of the command
return "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what `" + commandName + "` means :-(";
* Argument stores a {@link Command} argument's name, and it's associated value.
* <li>If the name matches the command, it is defined to be the default argument.
* Constructor for this argument without a value
* @param name the name of this argument, which should not be null
// null represents the value that isn't there
* Constructor for this argument with a value and name.
* @param name the name of this argument, which should not be null
* @param value the value of this argument, which can be null
* Gets the value of this argument.
* Checks if the other argument has the same name as this.
* @param otherArgument the other argument to compare with
* @return true if the name is the same, otherwise false
* Checks if the other argument has the same name as this.
* @param otherArgumentName the other argument name, as a string, to compare with
* @return true if the name is the same, otherwise false
* Command defines the possible unique callable names, and it's {@link Argument}(s).
* Mark the task as not done.
* Stores the usage hint for this command.
* Stores the expected arguments of this command.
* Constructor for this command, which parses the expected arguments.
* <li>The first argument has the name of the command.
* <li>If the value is null, there is no value for that argument. Otherwise, the value is required.
* @param arguments the arguments of this command
// Name of the argument is the first argument
* Generates the usage string of this command using the arguments.
* @param arguments the expected arguments of this command
// not null indicates that a value should be present.
* Checks if the command expects an argument name.
* @param otherArgument the argument with the name to find
* @return true if the command has that argument name, otherwise false
* Gets the name of the command.
* Validates the supplied argument names and values
* @throws ActionException If an argument is missing.
public void validateSuppliedArguments(Argument[] suppliedArguments) throws ActionException {
* ExpectedArgument encapsulates the behaviour of arguments that a command can expect.
* <li>An ExpectedArgument list generates the usage hint for a command.
public final class ExpectedArgument extends Argument {
* Constructor for this argument without a value.
* @param name the name of this argument, which should not be null
* Constructor for this argument with a value and name.
* @param name  the name of this argument, which should not be null
* @param valueUsageName the value of this argument, as a descriptive name of its purpose
* Validates the supplied argument using this expected argument for the presence or lack of a value.
* If this value is null, then no value is expected.
* @param command the command with that supplied argument
* @param suppliedArgument the other argument to compare with
* @throws ActionException If the argument has a missing or unexpected value.
public void validateArgument(Command command, Argument suppliedArgument) throws ActionException {

* Gets a human-readable description of this task.
* @return this task in a human-readable string

* @param startDateTime the starting date/time of this event
* @param endDateTime the ending date/time of this event
public Event(String name, String startDateTime, String endDateTime) {
* Gets a human-readable description of this task.
* @return this task in a human-readable string
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), startDateTime, endDateTime);
